Sequence Information.Peptide Name: TsAP-1 (T. serrulatus antimicrobial peptide 1; scorpions, arachnids, invertebrates, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the non-disulfide-bridged peptide (NDBP) superfamily. Short antimicrobial peptide (group 4) family.
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.23770440] Gram-positive bacteria :Staphylococcus aureus(MIC=120 μM, MBC>160 μM);Gram-negative bacteria :Escherichia coli(MIC=160 μM, MBC>160 μM);Fungi :Candida albicans(MIC=160 μM, MBC>160 μM)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.23770440] 0% hemolysis at 40 μM , 2% hemolysis at 80 μM , 5% hemolysis at 120 μM , 7% hemolysis at 160 μM against horse red blood cells
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria. Antifungal activity against Candida albicans, Anticancer activity against HI57 and H838.

Literature.Title: Two peptides, TsAP-1 and TsAP-2, from the venom of the Brazilian yellow scorpion, Tityus serrulatus evaluation of their antimicrobial and anticancer activities.
Literature.Author: Guo X, Ma C, Du Q, Wei R, Wang L, Zhou M, Chen T, Shaw C.
